tit.j: 舞鶴東インターチェンジ

sen.j: 舞鶴東インターチェンジ（まいづるひがしインターチェンジ）は、舞鶴若狭自動車道のインターチェンジで京都府舞鶴市堂奥に位置する。
sen.e: The Maizuru Higashi Interchange, located at Dono-oku, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, is an interchange of the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway.
sen.cmt: 読みは訳し出ししていません。http://www.wdic.org/w/GEO/舞鶴若狭自動車道http://www.excite.co.jp/map/address/26/202/
sen.e: The Maizuru Higashi Interchange, located in Dono-oku, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, is an interchange of the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway.
The Maizuru Higashi Interchange, located in Dono-oku, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, is an interchange of the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）3月9日まで旧舞鶴自動車道の終点である。
sen.e: It was the terminus of Old Maizuru Jidoshado Expressway until March 9, 2003.
It was the terminus of Old Maizuru Jidoshado Expressway until March 9, 2003.
It was the terminus of Old Maizuru Jidoshado Expressway until March 9, 2003.

sen.j: 京都府北部の中心都市である舞鶴市の東地区の玄関口であり、舞鶴市役所や京都府中丹広域振興局、舞鶴港の小樽行き新日本海フェリー乗り場に最も近いインターチェンジである。
sen.e: It is a doorway to the eastern area of Maizuru City, the central city of Northern Kyoto Prefecture, and is the most nearest to the Maizuru City Hall, Chutan Regional Development Bureau of Kyoto Prefecture, and Shin-Nihonkai Ferry Landing at Maizuru Port for the ferry bound for Otaru.
sen.cmt: 京都府中丹広域振興局：定訳不明http://www.city.maizuru.kyoto.jp/http://www.snf.jp/
sen.e: It's a gateway to the eastern area of Maizuru City (the central city in northern Kyoto Prefecture) and is the most nearest to Maizuru City Hall, the Chutan Regional Development Bureau of Kyoto Prefecture, and Shin-Nihonkai Ferry Landing at Maizuru Port for the ferry bound for Otaru.

It's a gateway to the eastern area of Maizuru City (the central city in northern Kyoto Prefecture) and is the most nearest to Maizuru City Hall, the Chutan Regional Development Bureau of Kyoto Prefecture, and Shin-Nihonkai Ferry Landing at Maizuru Port for the ferry bound for Otaru.

sen.j: 舞鶴若狭自動車道（8番）
1998年（平成10年）3月18日：舞鶴自動車道の終点として開業。
sen.e: March 18, 1998: Opened as the terminal interchange of the Maizuru Jidoshado Expressway.
sen.cmt: 終点のインターチェンジと訳してあります。
sen.e: March 18, 1998: It opened as the terminal interchange of the Maizuru Jidoshado Expressway.
March 18, 1998: It opened as the terminal interchange of the Maizuru Jidoshado Expressway.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）3月9日：舞鶴東ICより小浜西ICまで延伸。
sen.e: March 9, 2003: Extended from Maizuru Higashi Interchange to Obama Nishi Interchange.
March 9, 2003: It was extended from the Maizuru Higashi Interchange to the Obama Nishi Interchange.
March 9, 2003: It was extended from the Maizuru Higashi Interchange to the Obama Nishi Interchange.
